stadium.name: The Su'akour Bowl
stadium.description: A crude, rowdy stadium built within the half-finished, black-stone walls of the warlord Su'akour's abandoned fortress. The stands are crumbling ruins, and the entire arena perpetually stinks of the nearby sulfur marshes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Staring at a single blade of grass until their eyes water.
Wiping a teammate's sweat onto their own forehead.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.

stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.

preGame:
# üèüÔ∏è WELCOME TO THE STINKY PIT OF DESTINY! 

Hello, hello, hello, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the Su'akour Bowl, where the air is thick with the scent of sulfur and the sweet, sweet aroma of impending doom! We are in the thick of the playoffs, folks, and the atmosphere is so tense you could cut it with a rusted dague! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres are up one game in this Best of 3 series, and they are looking to close the show tonight. But the Brimstone Fire Eaters are back on their home turf, surrounded by crumbling walls and enough noxious fumes to make a ghoul gag! 

Would you look at the dedication on these athletes? I see Glassman Solley over there for the Fire Eaters, literally washing his hands with dirt! That's the kind of grit we love to see in Trollball‚Äîgetting down and dirty before the first blow is even struck! Meanwhile, Nigel Rothmuller is consulting some folk rhymes about the weather. I can tell you the forecast, Nigel: it‚Äôs raining pain with a hundred percent chance of casualties! Over on the Bizarres' sideline, Quintessa Austine is trying to start a slow clap again. It‚Äôs not catching on, Quintessa, but I admire the persistence! 

Neither of these teams has a massive following today‚Äîit seems the 'heroes' of the realm like Sir Tanos and that celebrity-status Artorias are too busy being 'bold' and 'slaying monsters' to attend a real sport. Their loss! More room for us to watch the carnage! And don't forget, folks, the stakes are sky-high! The loser of this series gets sent straight to the loser's bracket. It‚Äôs win or go home to count your bruises! Let‚Äôs get that troll head bouncing! üèàüî•
postGame:
# üåã BRIMSTONE BITES BACK! WE'RE GOING TO GAME THREE! 

Great spirits of the Abyss, what a defensive clinic! If you like your Trollball with a side of absolute lockdown and a sprinkle of internal bleeding, this was the game for you! The Brimstone Fire Eaters have defended their fortress, taking Game Two with a gritty 1 to 0 victory over the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres! We are all tied up, sports fans, and this playoff series is headed for a do-or-die Game Three finale! 

The first half was a literal meat grinder! We barely had the ball in play before the bodies started hitting the uneven ground! Glassman Solley, with those dirt-caked hands, absolutely leveled Kristin Kronfeld early on! But the Bizarres didn't just sit there; Melesa Zelten answered back by sending Nachison Icken to the medical tent. It was a beautiful symphony of crunching bones and clanging steel! 

Oona Jane wasn't about to be left out of the highlight reel, tackling Willa Lois into the dirt, while Bollinger Susette decided Milo Nelie didn't need to be standing anymore. By the time Nigel Rothmuller sent Pompei Hephzipa to the sidelines, I was starting to think the healers would run out of bandages! It‚Äôs a miracle anyone was left for the halftime orange slices! 

Speaking of halftime, Raphael Miyasawa must have given one heck of a pep talk‚Äîor maybe she just kissed her biceps extra hard! Because when the Fire Eaters came back out, they were on fire! Campball Fink, who spent her pre-game stomping in muddy puddles, showed off some real finesse, picking up the troll head and firing a precision pass to Nigel Rothmuller to keep the drive alive! 

Then came the moment that defined the night! Glassman Solley, the dirt-covered dynamo, took the ball in the Away 2-Point zone and pulled off a move I haven't seen since my days in the Demon Prison! He passed the ball to... himself! A self-alley-oop right in the End Zone for a thunderous dunk! The scoreboard ticked over to 1-0, and the Su'akour Bowl erupting was louder than a chorus of wailing banshees! 

The Bizarres tried to claw their way back, they really did! Quintessa Austine made a desperate run for the goal, looking like he was finally getting that slow clap he wanted, but the Brimstone defense was like a wall of obsidian. Every time the Bizarres got close, the Fire Eaters just knocked them back down. 

The violence in the second half was even more delicious than the first! Aggri Cookie took out Selimah Tully with a hit that surely shook the foundations of the Su'akour Ruins. But Gagliano Tallbott wasn't finished, returning the favor by flattening Bollinger Susette! The lagoon-dwellers were fighting for their playoff lives, but the fumes of Brimstone were just too much to overcome! 

Late in the game, Quintessa Austine tried to swing the momentum by injuring Lowson Hersh, but Campball Fink ended any hope of a comeback by absolutely pancaking Aggri Cookie! The Bizarres' shooters just couldn't find the basket tonight‚ÄîAggri Cookie and Quintessa Austine both took long-range shots that went wider than Governor-King Zenku‚Äôs ego! 

I have to say, seeing these 'heroes' of the realm absent while these warriors bleed for our entertainment just warms my cold, demonic heart. Who needs Sir Artorias or the 'Benevolent' Nikos Thanae when you have Glassman Solley dunking on faces? They're probably off having a tea party with Maple the tree while real Trollball history is being written in the dirt! 

So, here we stand! One win for the Bizarres, one win for the Fire Eaters. It all comes down to Game Three! The pressure is higher than the stilts at the Prismatic Pavilion! Will the Bizarres' theatrical flair win out, or will the Fire Eaters' sheer brutality carry them through? I can't wait to find out! 

Final Score: The Brimstone Fire Eaters 1 - The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres 0! Series tied 1-1! Don't go anywhere, because the next game is going to be a total slaughter! üèüÔ∏èüíÄ
